1.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Ijob, the patriarch famous for his patience
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

2.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
to be dark (as withholding light); transitively, to darken
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
a word; collectively, a discourse; figuratively, a topic
properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.

3.brief: 'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction
properly, a valiant man or warrior; generally, a person simply
the loins (as the seat of vigor)
to inquire; by implication, to request; by extension, to demand

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

4.brief: what place?; also (of time) when?; or (of means) how?
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to set (literally or figuratively); intensively, to found; reflexively, to sit down together, i.e. settle, consult
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

5.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

desire (and so probably in Proverbs 31:4); hence (by way of alternative) or, also if
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a cord (as connecting), especially formeasuring; figuratively, a rule; also a rim, a musical string or accord

6.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
a basis (of a building, a column, etc.)
desire (and so probably in Proverbs 31:4); hence (by way of alternative) or, also if
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach
an angle; by implication, a pinnacle; figuratively, a chieftain

7.brief: properly, to creak (or emit a stridulous sound), i.e. to shout (usually for joy)
a star (as round or as shining); figuratively, a prince
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
to mar (especially by breaking); figuratively, to split the ears (with sound), i.e. shout (for alarm or joy)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

8.brief: properly, to entwine as ascreen; by implication, to fence in, cover over, (figuratively) protect
something swinging, i.e. the valve of adoor

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
to gush forth (as water), generally to issue
to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.

9.brief: to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud
a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife

an enactment; hence, an appointment (of time, space, quantity, labor or usage)
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
something swinging, i.e. the valve of adoor

this place (French ici), i.e. here or hence
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to add or augment (often adverbial, to continue to do a thing)
this place (French ici), i.e. here or hence
to place (in a very wide application)
something rolled, i.e. a heap of stone or dung (plural ruins), by analogy, a spring of water (plural waves)

12.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

13.brief: to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)
an edge or extremity; specifically (of a bird or army) a wing, (of a garment or bedclothing) a flap, (of the earth) a quarter, (of a building) a pinnacle
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

14.brief: to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
properly, a bubbling up, i.e. of water, a wave; of earth, mire or clay (cement); also a heap; hence, a chomer or dry measure
to place (any thing so as to stay); reflexively, to station, offer, continue
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife

morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)

as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)

to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)

an opening, i.e. door or gate
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
an opening, i.e. door or gate
shade of death, i.e. the grave (figuratively, calamity)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
to reside or permanently stay (literally or figuratively)
illumination or (concrete) luminary (in every sense, including lightning, happiness, etc.)

to take (in the widest variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to

to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
